entry.title: Combined summary - Blockchain Voluntary Fork (Split) Proposal (Chaofan Li)
entry.summary: The discussion on the bitcoin-dev mailing list revolves around how to handle mining on each chain and the value of each chain. One proposal being discussed is a sidechain proposal with the same protocol. The argument that having one money is better than two is made due to the exchange cost between them. Fungibility applies to cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin, where the use of sidechains ensures that a sidechain coin is exchangeable for a mainchain coin. Mechanisms such as SPV proof-of-work and drivechain proof-of-voting are used to ensure this exchangeability. However, proposals need to differentiate themselves from previous ones like 2X and BCash.The conversation between ZmnSCPxj and Chaofan revolves around the concept of fungibility in paper money and Bitcoin. They discuss whether bitcoins generated from different blocks have the same value and if they can be traced back to their block of origin, would they be worth different amounts? They also raise the question of whether fungibility should have a measurable or evaluative value rather than being binary.Mark Friedenbach explains that tokens which are worth more value will attract more mining hash rate and miners respond to cash-out value, they don't set it. Additionally, the value of block space in Bitcoin is often found to be confusing. Miners invest capital before any block space can exist which results from anticipation of future returns.The relationship between mining power and cryptocurrency value is multifaceted and dependent on different variables. Ilan Oh's statement about the chain with the most mining power having more value is challenged by Mark Friedenbach, who believes the causality is actually backwards. Lastly, the conversation revolves around the possibility of eliminating human perception of difference in money. By showing only the total amount of bitcoin instead of separating it into different types, there would be no difference between the number of merchants since their addresses are valid on both chains.
